attributes.action: Stop single supplement payments on holidays.
attributes.additional_details: Over the past couple of years I have been to Llandudno, Bournemouth, Torquay in the UK and The Rhine Valley in Germany.  Each holiday I have had to pay either £60 or £80 extra for travelling alone.  I feel this is so unfair and discriminatory.
attributes.background: I am a widow and have been on several holidays on my own.  I feel that it is very unfair that I have to pay extra for exactly the same holidays as couples and families partake in.

rejection.details:
This is the responsibility of travel companies, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could start a new petition asking Parliament to change the law, to make it illegal to charge a single supplement, if that's what you'd like to happen.
